rules: Rule1: If the park visitor center serves beer, then alcohol is permitted in the camping area.
Rule2: Either the park visitor center serves beer or the visitor center is open.
Rule3: Whenever headquarters mandated compliance, then if the park manager issued a directive, it follows that if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Rule4: Under the condition that the regional director approved the policy, headquarters mandated compliance.
Rule5: Either a public protest occurred regarding the regulation or the regional director approved the policy.
Rule6: Political pressure was applied against the ban, or it is not the case that a public protest occurred regarding the regulation.
Rule7: Either the no-alcohol rule is enforced or a nature tour is provided as an alternative activity.
Rule8: Provided that a nature tour is provided as an alternative activity, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Rule9: Whenever ranger patrols occur in the camping area, then if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Rule10: If a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage, then if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Rule11: Under the condition that a ranger is assigned to patrol duty, ranger patrols occur in the camping area.
Rule12: Either a ranger is assigned to patrol duty or maintenance is assigned to post signs.
Rule13: If maintenance is assigned to post signs, then a no-alcohol notice is posted on signage.
Rule14: Provided that a supervisor ordered enforcement, if the no-alcohol rule is enforced, then alcohol is not permitted in the camping area.
Rule15: Either a supervisor ordered enforcement or the park manager issued a directive.
facts: Fact1: Political pressure applied against the ban is not the case.

question: The park visitor center is open.
